result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo L Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Upon successful completion of the sentence,  Court will allow for expungement.
Follow all rules of supervision.   Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

Pay all of following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including  DNA surcharge.  
All applicable fees of supervision.

timeConds.notes: Commencement STAYED until 10/16/2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Huber.

records.addlTxt: Order For Cancellation of Huber/ Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
CANCELLATION OF HUBER / WORK RELEASE / ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE PRIVILEGES PURSUANT TO WISCONSIN STATUTES SECTION 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Witkowiak, Br 22, for review.  jm

Defendant Deangelo L Lee in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.    Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Aiea J.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 90 days condition time with Huber. Court stayed commencement until 10/16/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

 Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo L Lee in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 09/28/2015 is vacated.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deangelo L Lee in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  (Defendant is not able to appear at previously scheduled time of 8:30 a.m. due to another pending court date.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/7/15.

Defendant Deangelo L Lee in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Deangelo L Lee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
